newsitem.title: JAPAN: Nippon Life says to launch joint venture in China.
newsitem.headline: Nippon Life says to launch joint venture in China.

text.p: Nippon Life Insurance Co will launch an insurance joint venture in China, Nippon Life president Josei Itoh told reporters on Tuesday.
Itoh said that the company and China's biggest insurer, the People's Insurance Co of China (PICC), would decide later on the specifics of the joint venture in China.
Nippon Life would be the first foreign company to specialise in providing life insurance coverage in China, Itoh said.
Among Japanese non-life insurers, only Tokio Marine & Fire Insurance Co Ltd currently operates in China, he said.
Nippon Life said on Monday that it plans to set up a joint venture in the Philippines. It would become the first Japanese company to sell life insurance policies abroad, it said.
The company said it and the Yuchengco Group of the Philippines would sign a contract by the year-end to establish a joint venture by next March.

Nippon Life will own 50 percent of the joint venture, which will be based in Manila. The rest will be owned by two Yuchengco Group firms -- 30 percent by Great Pacific Life Assurance Corp and 20 percent by Rizal Commercial Banking Corp.
Itoh said it also plans to buy a stake of up to nine percent in Thai life insurer Bangkok Life Assurance Ltd before the end of March next year.
Nippon Life is the largest Japanese insurer as well as one of the world's top providers of life cover. It has assets of about 39 trillion yen.
